in-33541dcf08b547a8,"indeed","https://it.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=33541dcf08b547a8","https://www.b1pgroup.com/annuncio/people-engagement-talent-acquisition-project-hr/","People Engagement, Talent Acquisition & Project HR","B1P Group","Roma, LAZ, IT","2026-02-27","","","","","","",True,"","","","hr@b1pgroup.com","**Descrizione**

B1P Group è la principale società di consulenza nel settore del BIM, che sta rivoluzionando il settore AEC italiano. Quello che ci caratterizza rispetto alle altre aziende è la dinamicità del nostro team e l’innovazione tecnologica che mettiamo in campo in qualunque settore di business in cui operiamo.

I nostri clienti sono grandi multinazionali, piccole imprese e pubbliche amministrazioni. La nostra cultura del lavoro si basa sulla fiducia, l’autonomia e il rispetto tra le persone, ed è incentrata sul raggiungimento dei risultati attraverso una modalità di lavoro ibrida.
**Di cosa ti occuperai**
* Ti occuperai di applicare politiche retributive e di benefit, di welfare e di inclusion management secondo le linee guida di aziendali
* Gestione ed organizzazione degli eventi aziendali
Definire, analizzare e monitorare il budget del costo del personale
* Gestire il processo di on\-boarding
Applicare il sistema identitario e valoriale del modello di leadership e le sue competenze
* Curare il Change Management ed i progetti di HR Transformation
* Contribuire a creare un ambiente innovativo, in continua crescita, contribuendo a migliorare la qualità e la gestione complessiva delle nostre attività
* Supportare le attività di consulenza nella gestione delle attività relative al personale, inclusa la conformità con il diritto del lavoro
* Elaborare ed aggiornare i documenti del Sistema Normativo Interno e del Sistema Organizzativo
* Assistere nella preparazione e nel monitoraggio dei piani di budget per i costi del personale utilizzando un sistema digitale di pianificazione della forza lavoro
* Definire e implementare piani di formazione, in base alle esigenze del progetto.
#### **Requisiti**
Chi stiamo cercando? Professionisti con:
* Un mindset analitico, passione e spirito di squadra
Spiccate doti relazionali ed organizzative
* Ottima conoscenza di Excel, Power Point e Power BI
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.
Nice to have:
* Esperienza pregressa in ambito recruiting (preferibilmente su profili tech/AEC)
* Competenza nell’utilizzo di piattaforme di social recruiting e strumenti di valutazione dei candidati
* Abilità nell’analisi dei dati di recruiting per migliorare i processi e le strategie di assunzione
* Abilità nella gestione del personale interno e di pianificazione di commesse.
#### **Location**
da Remoto – Roma
#### **Tipologia**
Lungo termine
#### **Specializzazione**
HR – Acquisizione Talenti – Gestione Progetti
#### **Incarico**
Si offre inserimento diretto a tempo indeterminato/determinato o collaborazione a P.IVA (in base alle preferenze del candidato selezionato)
**Invia il tuo CV e breve Portfolio a: hr@b1pgroup.com**","","https://it.indeed.com/cmp/B1p-Group","","","","","","","","","","","","","talent acquisition"

in-6385d2a3a4e7a915,"indeed","https://it.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=6385d2a3a4e7a915","https://harri.com/Zuma-Rome-2/job/2657885-sommelier-1001?utm_source=indeed&utm_medium=listing&utm_content=foh-roma-zuma-rome-english-february282026&utm_campaign=indeed-foh","Sommelier - Porto Cervo","Zuma","Roma, LAZ, IT","2026-02-26","parttime","","","","","",False,"","","","","As a Sommelier at Zuma, you’ll pair exceptional wines and sakes with unforgettable moments, ensuring smooth service, maximizing sales, and delivering top\-tier customer satisfaction. Elevate the Zuma dining experience with your wine and sake expertise!

Zuma is a contemporary Japanese restaurant collection, inspired by the dynamic Izakaya dining style. This role will be based in Zuma Porto Cervo. Set against the stunning green\-blue coastline of Sardinia, our exceptional restaurant captures the essence of a truly iconic seasonal experience within one of the Mediterranean's most prestigious destinations. Zuma Porto Cevo is proud to be part of the Azumi Collection.
Main Duties
Your key responsibilities will include:
Collaborate with the front\-of\-house team to deliver seamless and efficient wine and sake service daily
Use your in\-depth knowledge of wine, sake, and food pairings to enhance guest experiences and drive sales
Manage wine and sake stock levels and oversee ordering procedures with accuracy and care
Monitor and maintain wine and sake service equipment, addressing any needs with management
Build relationships with regular guests and high\-value customers, creating lasting connections
Handle guest feedback professionally, keeping senior management informed of key updates
What We Look For
Our ideal candidate embodies our values and brings:
A genuine love for culinary experiences \& a passion for Japanese cuisine
Proven experience as a sommelier in a luxury high\-volume restaurant
A natural team player who is at home working in sync with a large team
Naturally friendly, customer\-oriented, and skilled at creating memorable dining experiences
Benefits

We offer incredible career growth, international opportunities, and the chance to contribute to a world\-renowned brand, where every detail from the finest ingredients to our unrivalled atmosphere is crafted to perfection.
As part of our team, you’ll enjoy:
Accommodation is provided during the season \& our team is always there to support with any accommodation queries
World\-Class training, designed to inspire and educate
Global opportunities, experience hospitality around the globe with our five incredible brands
Family Meals are shared daily
Rewards \& Recognition, we value our team and celebrate your contributions to our success with meaningful rewards and recognition
Dining discount, enjoy exclusive discounts across the Azumi group, worldwide!
Our Commitment to Inclusivity
We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome all applicants. If you require any assistance to make the recruitment process more accessible, please let one of our Talent Acquisition team know.

in-ed9b83172f8defb9,"indeed","https://it.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=ed9b83172f8defb9","https://careers.moveax.it/o/compliance-specialist-sgi-hse-gdpr?source=Indeed","Compliance Specialist (SGI, HSE, GDPR)","Moveax","Roma, LAZ, IT","2026-02-26","fulltime","","","","","",False,"","","","","**Junior** **Compliance Specialist (SGI, HSE, GDPR)**
Roma / hybrid \| Full\-time \| € 23\.000 – € 28\.000
#### **Who We Are**

We are a boutique consulting company that supports businesses and institutions in their digital transformation, bringing enterprise\-level technology into complex and challenging projects. From strategy to delivery and operational management, we work with cloud, artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, and blockchain/DLT, adopting an end\-to\-end approach focused on maximizing value for our clients.

Our ambition is to be the best possible partner for those who want to tackle everyday technological challenges with method and speed. We treat our clients’ projects with the same care we dedicate to our internal products, continuously improving processes and methodologies to achieve tangible and measurable results.

Our headquarters are located in Rome, between the Trastevere and San Pietro neighborhoods. We operate actively in sectors such as mobility and transportation, banking \& finance, public administration, and defense. Our main competitive advantage is a team of young, passionate talents capable of turning complex challenges into real solutions.
#### **Role Vision \& Profile**

We are looking for someone who sees rules as tools, not obstacles: a person eager to learn how to manage and improve business processes, contributing to making the company safe, efficient, and responsible.

The ideal candidate is curious, detail\-oriented, and highly organized, with the ability to tackle complex problems by studying relevant regulations and procedures to identify practical solutions, while collaborating with all company departments.
#### **What You Will Do**

As a Compliance Specialist at moveax, you will join the Compliance Office, working alongside the Compliance Manager to support and enhance the company’s integrated management system, with a focus on quality (ISO 9001\), information security (ISO 27001\), and gender equality (UNI PDR 125:2022\). You will operate within the IT \& Innovation Consultancy industry, helping ensure compliance in a highly innovative and technological environment, while collaborating with all company departments.
Specifically, you will be responsible for supporting:
* the updating of processes, procedures, and policies to ensure compliance and continuous improvement
* implementation of improvement initiatives
* risk management and handling of non\-conformities
* monitoring of compliance KPIs and objectives
* preparation and execution of internal and external audits
* preparation and delivery of compliance training
* assisting different organizational units in maintaining compliance
* basic HSE activities
* acquisition of new company certifications.
#### **Why Join Us**
* **challenging and diverse projects:** you will have the opportunity to work on complex and varied initiatives that will allow you to grow continuously and tackle new challenges
* **real impact:** you will contribute to shaping company decisions and improving internal processes, making your work truly meaningful
* **collaboration with top company functions**: you will work closely with the company’s strategic functions, with opportunities to learn, propose solutions, and participate in key decisions
* **training and mentoring:** you will receive support and training on ISO standards, governance and compliance tools, audit methodologies, document management, HSE, and risk management

* **cross\-functional growth and development path:** at moveax, we support both vertical growth toward more senior or coordination roles, and horizontal growth by exploring related paths based on your skills and potential
* **flexible work model:** you will work in a hybrid and flexible environment that values work–life balance
* **inclusive work environment:** at moveax, we value diversity and promote an inclusive workplace where everyone can express their ideas and contribute to shared success.
#### **What Else You Will Find**
if you want a book, we’ll get it for you
PlayStation
free beer on Fridays
* coffee always available
✈️ annual team\-building trips
budget for courses, certifications, and industry conferences.
#### **Interview Process**
**Step 1 – Introductory interview**

In this stage, you’ll have a first call with one of our recruiters. We will ask questions related to your CV and your answers in the questionnaire. We’ll also check your availability for on\-site or hybrid work. During the call, you will take a short English test to assess your written and spoken skills.
**Step 2 – Interview with a Senior \& Practical Task**

In this phase, you will meet a Senior member of our Compliance Office. This is an informal conversation where you can ask questions about the role, the team, and daily activities, while we also dive deeper into your past experiences and align on mutual expectations for the position.During the meeting, you will also be asked to complete a practical task related to the Compliance Specialist role, designed to assess your problem\-solving approach, analytical skills, understanding of regulations and processes, and clarity in communicating conclusions and recommendations.
**Step 3 – Final Interview with a Management Representative**

This phase consists of a more strategic conversation with a representative of the company’s management, to whom the Compliance Office directly reports. We will discuss your long\-term professional growth, career goals, and any remaining questions you may have. It will also be a great opportunity for you to get to know the company culture more closely.
**Step 4 – Job offer**
If everything goes well, our team will contact you to discuss the offer details: compensation, start date, and next steps. We look forward to having you on board!
#### **Equality \& Inclusion \- Talent Acquisition Policy**

moveax is an equal opportunity employer in accordance with laws 903/77 and 125/91 (regarding gender) and legislative decrees 215/03 and 216/03 (regarding age and nationality). We encourage applications from everyone, regardless of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, age, disability, or any other characteristic. We firmly believe in creating an inclusive and diverse work environment where every talent has the opportunity to grow and contribute to our success.
#### **️** **Hard Skills**
* degree in Law or Management Engineering
* interest and motivation for compliance and HSE
* understanding of regulations, procedures, and business processes
* fluent Italian and English (B2\+ written and spoken).
#### **Soft Skills**
* precision, organization, and attention to detail to ensure accuracy and quality in every activity
* curiosity and motivation to learn and grow professionally
* organizational and planning skills, both individually and within a team, for managing tasks and priorities
* analytical and problem\-solving skills, with the ability to identify connections between processes, regulations, and procedures
* ability to work in a team, sharing knowledge and skills
* proactivity and reliability.
* participation in activities with organizational responsibilities
* familiarity with certified management systems
* basic knowledge of ISO 9001, ISO 27001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001
* basic knowledge of Legislative Decree 81/08 (workplace safety)
* basic understanding of GDPR principles and Italian privacy regulations
* familiarity with document management and corporate archiving principles
* use of digital tools (Google Workspace, Jira, Miro).","","https://it.indeed.com/cmp/Moveax","","https://www.moveax.it/","","","","","","","","","","","talent acquisition"

in-7f74a447c548c54a,"indeed","https://it.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=7f74a447c548c54a","https://jobs.msd.com/gb/en/job/MSD1GBR359431ENGB/Therapeutic-Area-Lead-Director-Specialty-Immunology-Ophthalmology-and-Neuroscience?utm_source=indeed&utm_medium=phenom-feeds","Therapeutic Area Lead (Director) - Specialty (Immunology, Ophthalmology and Neuroscience)","MSD","Roma, LAZ, IT","2026-02-26","fulltime","","","","","",False,"","","","","Job Description

The *Medical Affairs Director Specialty* is a member of the Local Medical Affairs LT and acts as ‘Medical Partner’, in the cross functional team, to give input and share decision on the key strategies to ensure early and broad access to current and future *products in Specialty*, with adequate recognition of the value of our pipeline and our products.
**Responsibilities include but will not be limited to the following key activities:**
* To have a strategic view and strong scientific knowledge of our Specialty and pipeline portfolio with main focus on immunology, ophthalmology and neuroscience
* To have strong people management skills: achieving results through people, motivation, inspiring, coaching and developing people
* Budget management
* To be a key scientific reference for Scientific leaders and Scientific societies

* To organize and attend at national and international scientific events (meetings, congresses and symposium). To cooperate in the organization of scientific meetings, sponsored or fully organized by our company. To contact and assist foreign and local speakers, as well as local speakers invited by our Company Human Health Division or other subsidiaries
* Medical review / approval of promotional material and medical information \& communication \& trainings materials in general according to the actual SOP
* To be accountable for coordination and properly implementation of local studies and for supporting independent studies and external collaborations

* To provide Medical support to key activities aimed to guarantee equitable access to our Products in Specialty and support our product value at local, regional and national level (e.g. dossier for P\&R)
* To ensure continuous support to the Specialty medical team for Life Cycle Management opportunities, liaising global communications and local needs
* To deliver presentations at medical meetings and events
* Organization and implementation of gathering insights activities
* To ensure the cross functional team and sales teams are kept up to date with new scientific data. To detect, comply and analyze all information on our company’s and competitive landscape
* To partner with Country Medical Director, Regulatory and other internal stakeholders to deliver objectives
* To engage with and provide regular updates to the Managing Director and local management team
* To support GCTO in the Identification of potential investigators with adequate profile and infrastructure
* To provide Medical support to Regulatory and Pharmacovigilance areas
* To maintain and strengthen a fluent relationship with medical and government officials, at a level of cooperative and scientific interchange
* To be the final responsible for the elaboration of the Local Specialty Medical Affairs Plans and V\&I plan, maintaining alignment with the overall company strategy
* To drive and implement non promotional “Medical Own Meetings” related to New Products \& Specialty
* To collaborate with SL speaker program, aligned with our company’s procedure (GEMS–Country to Country program)
* To be accountable for implementation of procedures related to the New Products \& Specialty medical area.
**Your Profile**
**Qualification \& Experience:**

An MD is required and recommended for this position. Candidates should have at least five years of experience in the global biopharmaceutical industry, specifically within Medical Affairs. Additionally, experience as a people manager is strongly recommended.
**Skills:**
* Demonstrated effective organizational skills, including ability to set goals and align priorities
* Experience in the following field: immunology, ophthalmology, neuroscience and Public Health.
* Leadership: Proactively identify projects and opportunities
* Cross Functional Team Leadership: Establish, facilitate and drive towards reaching objectives
* General business analytical skills: understand, analyze, evaluate and interpret financial statements
* Negotiating (protecting our company's interests)
* Problem Solving
* Conceptual \& Strategic thinking
* Presentation Skills
* Risk analysis and Evaluation
* Objective driven
* Excellent written and oral Communication
* High level of interpersonal skills
* Evaluating/Judgement
* Resilience
* Influencing

* Demonstrated creativity and effectiveness in addressing strategic challenges, an entrepreneurial mindset, and capability of thinking out of the box and taking measured risks

in-4150b46b0e41e58d,"indeed","https://it.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=4150b46b0e41e58d","https://grupporeda.factorial.it/apply/people-development-intern-287926?utm_source=indeed.com","People Development Intern","Successori Reda S.B.P.A.","Roma, LAZ, IT","2026-02-25","internship","","","","","",True,"","","","","Cosa troverai in Reda?
**1\. Un ambiente appassionato:** una realtà tessile italiana con oltre 150 anni di storia, dove tradizione artigianale e innovazione sostenibile si intrecciano ogni giorno.

**2\. Una realtà che mette al centro le persone:** in Reda, il benessere dei dipendenti è centrale. Favoriamo un ambiente collaborativo e ci impegniamo a creare uno spazio di lavoro in cui il rispetto, il supporto reciproco e il benessere sono priorità.

**3\. Un’azienda che vuole creare un impatto positivo:** come Società Benefit, integriamo nella nostra strategia obiettivi che vanno oltre il profitto, mirando a generare un impatto positivo su persone, comunità e ambiente.
**Chi cerchiamo:**

Siamo alla ricerca di una persona interessata al mondo delle risorse umane e appassionata al tessile le cui caratteristiche siano dinamismo, organizzazione ed empatia. Come People Development Intern ti occuperai di implementare le strategie di comunicazione interna ed esterna e di supportare il processo di Talent Acquisition.
La sede di lavoro sarà Valdilana con possibilità di smart working.
**La mission:**

Supporterai il Team HR del Gruppo nella gestione e creazione delle newsletter interne e di contenuti su LinkedIn, contribuendo alla definizione del piano editoriale. Inoltre, assisterai ai processi di ricerca, selezione, onboarding dei nuovi assunti e manterrai i rapporti con le scuole ed università con cui collaboriamo, organizzando e accompagnando nei tour del nostro Lanificio.
**Cosa ci aspettiamo da te:**
* Prima esperienza lavorativa
* Laurea in Comunicazione, Economia, Lettere, Psicologia o affini
* Conoscenza fluente della lingua inglese, sia parlata che scritta (B2/C1\)
* Ottime capacità di scrittura
* Buone doti comunicative e relazionali
* Master in HR sarà ritenuto titolo preferenziale
**Cosa ti offriamo:**
* Possibilità di Smart Working
* Ristorante aziendale
* Sconti prodotto
* Rimborso spese mensile","","https://it.indeed.com/cmp/Successori-Reda-S.b.p.a.","","","","","","","","","","","","","talent acquisition"

in-bd13c0d9256ac7fe,"indeed","https://it.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=bd13c0d9256ac7fe","https://careers.hostaway.com/o/sales-development-representative-spanish-speaking-100-remote-europe?source=Indeed","Sales Development Representative - (Spanish Speaking) - 100% remote - Europe","Hostaway","Roma, LAZ, IT","2026-02-25","fulltime","","","","","",True,"","","","","**NOTE: This is a FULLY remote role, but the candidate must be based within Europe and have Native level Spanish language proficiency to collaborate with their team, peers, and customers. You do not have to be in the specific country or city shown in this listing, but** **please only apply if you are physically based within Europe.**

Hostaway is the market\-leading SaaS scale\-up transforming the vacation rental industry. With innovative solutions and partnerships with giants like Airbnb, VRBO, and Booking, we're taking on the competition and winning. Leveraging our customer\-centric core values, we consistently deliver results that encourage growth, learning, and innovation for our team, our customers, and the industry.
Profitable, high\-growth, and the first short\-term rental PMS unicorn . Join us at our most exciting stage yet! Learn more about our recent valuation and story here.

Hostaway is seeking a highly motivated outbound Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our team and drive our growth in the Spanish market. We’re looking for driven, hungry, Sales professionals who are keen to make an impact with their work.
### **About the role**
* Research and identify potential clients and key decision\-makers within target industries and accounts in the European market, targeting Spanish speaking customers.
* Conduct outbound prospecting activities, including cold calling, email outreach, and social selling, to generate interest and qualify leads.
* Engage with prospects to understand their business needs, challenges, and objectives, and effectively communicate the value proposition of our products/services.
* Collaborate closely with the sales team to develop and execute strategic outreach campaigns and follow\-up strategies to drive engagement and conversion.
* Maintain accurate and up\-to\-date records of all prospect interactions and activities in the CRM system.
* Work closely with marketing to provide feedback on lead quality and campaign effectiveness, and leverage marketing materials to support outreach efforts.
* Meet and exceed monthly/quarterly targets for qualified meetings and pipeline generation.
* Previous outbound sales experience in a B2B SaaS environment.
* Strong prospecting and cold calling skills, with the ability to effectively engage and build rapport with prospects over the phone and via email.
* Highly motivated self\-starter with a proactive and entrepreneurial mindset.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously.
* Team player with strong interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate effectively across departments.
* Experience using CRM systems (e.g., Hubspot) and sales engagement tools (e.g., Outreach, SalesLoft) is a plus.
* Native level Spanish language skills and fluency in English (written and verbal), with excellent communication skills.
### **What we offer**
* **Competitive Compensation:** We offer competitive pay based on market rates in the country of the applicant.

* **100% Remote:** Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere within your country of residence—be it a co\-working space, your home office, or even your dining room table. The choice is yours. Just don’t ask to work in our office (we don’t have one).
* **Equity:** Every role in our company comes with valuable stock options in a fast\-growing and profitable company. This ensures we all share in the company’s success.
* **Values\-Driven Leadership:** Our Core Values are not just words we’ve written to make us feel good. We leverage them daily when making strategic and tactical decisions.

ILOS is a fast\-growing renewable energy company with a strong presence across Europe, backed by AXA IM Alts and committed to accelerating the energy transition. Since 2018, we have developed, built, and operated large\-scale solar PV projects across seven core markets.

We are hiring a senior project finance manager to lead the structuring and execution of financing for a major pipeline of solar projects in Italy. column2: an MBA or CFA is a plus.

DIVENTA INSIDE SALES ACCOUNT MANAGER IN HILTI.

In questo ruolo avrai la responsabilità di gestire e far crescere un portafoglio clienti già esistente, valorizzando le relazioni attive e sviluppando nuove opportunità all’interno della tua area. Lavorerai in stretta sinergia con gli altri canali di vendita, trasformando le strategie commerciali e di marketing in risultati concreti.

Sarà un’attività dinamica e coinvolgente: accompagnerai i clienti nella scelta delle soluzioni più innovative e vantaggiose per le loro esigenze, offrendo una consulenza affidabile e diventando un partner strategico.
Il ruolo è svolto completamente da remoto, non sono previste giornate di presenza in ufficio.
COSA FARAI
'\- Gestirai la tua attività completamente da remoto, mantenendo un contatto costante e proattivo con i clienti per comprenderne le esigenze e supportarli nello sviluppo del loro business.
* Metterai in campo le tue competenze commerciali e l’utilizzo di strumenti digitali avanzati per comunicare con efficacia il valore e la differenziazione delle soluzioni Hilti.
* Adotterai un approccio di vendita consulenziale, costruendo relazioni solide e guidando i clienti verso le soluzioni più innovative e adatte ai loro obiettivi.
* Sarai responsabile della gestione e dello sviluppo del Base Market, collaborando in sinergia con la rete degli Hilti Store presenti sul territorio.
* Lavorerai su lead qualificati, generati da analisi online, dagli altri canali di vendita e dal team Digital Marketing, così da concentrarti sulle opportunità con il maggiore potenziale.
COSA PORTI CON TE
Laurea
Eccellente padronanza degli strumenti e dei linguaggi digitali
Forte orientamento commerciale ed alla negoziazione
Forte empatia e capacità di creare ottime relazioni da remoto
Eccellenti capacità comunicative e interpersonali
Ottima organizzazione del tempo e capacità di stabilire le priorità
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
CHE VANTAGGI CI SONO PER TE?
Metteremo a tua disposizione tutto il necessario per permetterti di eccellere nel tuo ruolo, incluse una formazione continua e tante responsabilità sin dall'inizio.
Il nostro processo di selezione prevede i seguenti step:
Prima intervista telefonica con Talent Acquisition Business Partner
Colloquio conoscitivo su Teams con Talent Acquisition Business Partner e Isam Manager
Affiancamento: ci teniamo a farti comprendere a pieno il ruolo
Colloquio di approfondimento con due Isam Manager
PERCHÉ HILTI

Hilti è leader globale nell'innovazione nel settore delle costruzioni, con oltre 34\.000 membri del team in 120 Paesi. Ispirati dal nostro obiettivo di migliorare il settore delle costruzioni (Making Construction Better), vogliamo continuare a imparare, crescere e trovare nuovi modi per avere un impatto duraturo. In Hilti, ti daremo la possibilità di sfruttare i tuoi punti di forza, lavorare con un team globale e inclusivo e affrontare sfide significative. Con noi avrai l'opportunità di realizzare le tue idee, i tuoi obiettivi e la tua crescita grazie a determinazione, passione e lavoro di squadra.
IMPEGNO A FAVORE DELL'INCLUSIONE

In Hilti, l'inclusione è un aspetto fondamentale del modo in cui lavoriamo, guidiamo e cresciamo insieme. Siamo determinati ad abbracciare la diversità di pensiero e a creare un ambiente inclusivo per tutti, ovunque. Ci impegniamo costantemente per assicurarci che ogni voce sia apprezzata e che ogni membro del team senta di avere la possibilità di dare il proprio contributo. Costruendo su questa base, rafforziamo i nostri team, la nostra innovazione e il nostro impatto, migliorando il settore delle costruzioni insieme.
**APPLY NOW**

Job Description:

The Talent Acquisition \& Employer Branding Specialist will play a key role in attracting and hiring highly specialized scientific and technical talent, directly supporting Angelini Pharma’s R\&D and innovation priorities.

You will act as a trusted partner to R\&D leaders, combining deep sourcing expertise with a strong understanding of scientific talent markets, while contributing to strengthening our employer positioning within the pharmaceutical and research community.
**Key Responsibilities**
Talent Acquisition:
o Manage the full recruitment lifecycle for R\&D, scientific, regulatory, and technical roles
o Partner closely with Hiring Managers to translate scientific and pipeline needs into targeted sourcing strategies
o Conduct proactive market mapping and direct search within the pharma, biotech and academic ecosystem
o Build long\-term talent pipelines for critical and hard\-to\-fill scientific capabilities
o Provide data\-driven insights on talent availability, competitiveness and hiring trends
Employer Branding:
o Contribute to the development of a differentiated Employer Value Proposition for scientific and R\&D talent
o Support targeted employer branding initiatives within scientific communities and universities
o Collaborate with Communications to showcase research projects, innovation and impact
o Participate in scientific events and academic partnerships to strengthen Angelini Pharma’s presence in key talent markets
**Requirements:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Human Resources, Psychology, Business, Life Sciences, or related fields
* 3–5 years of experience in Talent Acquisition within the pharmaceutical industry or in a recruitment agency/headhunting firm, preferably with exposure to pharma clients
* Strong experience in recruiting R\&D, scientific, or highly specialized technical profiles
* Solid knowledge of sourcing techniques (direct search, LinkedIn Recruiter, talent mapping)
* Strong stakeholder management and communication skills
* Data\-driven mindset with experience tracking recruitment metrics
* Fluency in English (additional languages are a plus)
**What We Offer**
* The opportunity to contribute to meaningful innovation in the pharmaceutical sector
* Exposure to international projects and scientific environment
* A dynamic and collaborative HR team
* Professional growth in a company that values research, people, and purpose
**Angelini Pharma is an Equal Opportunity Employer.**

You are the first Prada Ambassador in the store, fostering a culture of Empathy, Warmth, Passion and Proactivity in line with Prada Client Experience. You will support the Store Manager in bringing to the store to full potential, achieving business results and qualitative objectives. You will also plan and cascades training programs in line with global, local and store priorities, promotes a culture of Shadowing: Observation, Feedback and Coaching at all Store levels and support the Store Leadership in Team development and driving performance of individual Client Advisors.
**RESPONSIBILITIES**
**PARTNER WITH STORE MANAGER \& STORE LEADERSHIP*** Identify training needs in line with business priorities
* Develop training action plans at a Store \& Client Advisor level
* Leverage in\-store training tools: training sessions, coaching sessions, Daily Briefing moments, and best\-practice sharing
* Collaborate with all other retail functions *(e.g., Merchandising, CRM, Events, etc.)* to jointly organize and manage specific training activities
* Perform Team gap analysis and build individual coaching plans, and provide ongoing feedback on individual team member progress, performance and training level
**TRAINING \& CONTENT*** Support Store Leadership to ensure full training contents cascading on Brand, Client Journey and Product knowledge
* Drive in\-store training initiatives with active shop floor presence
* Monitor quality, impact and true retention of training content
* Ensure Store Team embraces a self\-learning culture, with special attention to Retail Training Digital Tools (Training APP)

**CULTURE OF COACHING*** Lead a culture of in\-store coaching prioritizing Client Advisors according to their needs and focusing on selling skills, Client Experience, Clienteling, Styling, Brand ambassadorship and High\-End products
* Follow\-up with individual Shadowing (Observation / Feedback / Coaching) on Store Leadership to ensure a seamless and correct one\-to\-one process in store (Coach the Coach)
* Ensure regular communication with Trainees, giving them continuous feedback on progress
**ONBOARDING**
* Manage onboarding journeys for New Hires in the store by facilitating their in\-store induction and partnering with HR
**KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS**
Bachelor Degree in learning and development fields, human resources management, psychology, or a related field or vocational training.
5\+ years of experience in the retail training field or in a retail managerial role.
Completed trainer qualification and relevant professional experience
In\-depth knowledge of talent management and/or personnel development methods and tools
Excellent presentation and facilitation skills
Strong coordination and organizational skills, with a high level of communication ability
Fluent English is required

*Joining our Company means working in a creative and international environment, with teams of people motivated by curiosity and the quest for excellence. The engine of our success is the importance and value that we place on the talent and passion of our people leading to their own professional growth.*

*Prada Group promotes an inclusive work environment, ensuring equal opportunities for all candidates, regardless of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, or other personal characteristics. We believe that diversity is a value and we are committed to build a fair and respectful workplace for all.*","","https://it.indeed.com/cmp/Prada","https://d2q79iu7y748jz.cloudfront.net/s/_squarelogo/256x256/ed59614e77aa0c924777aa96e3003669","https://www.pradagroup.com","TERRANUOVA BRACCIOLINI, IT","10,000+","$1B to $5B (USD)","Prada S.p.A. has been concentrating its investments to pursue a long-term growth focused on the development of its owned brands and in strengthening its global retail network.","","","","","","","recruiter"

in-9e4d4e850de8c641,"indeed","https://it.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=9e4d4e850de8c641","http://it.indeed.com/job/hr-manager-9e4d4e850de8c641","HR Manager","Rome Business School","Roma, LAZ, IT","2026-02-24","fulltime","","","","","",False,"","","","","**Mission**

Act as the On site point of contact for managers and employees throughout the **HR annual life\- cycle** – ensuring adherence to Italian labour legislation, social\-security rules, and internal standards while fostering a high\-performance and inclusive culture.
**Core Activities**
* Liaise with external payroll provider on data accuracy. **Monitor harmonisation with National Collective Labour** Agreement (CCNL).
* Advise leaders on disciplinary procedures, individual \& collective agreements.
* Partner with hiring managers to define needs, draft job briefs and support with cycle recruitment.
* Guarantee consistent candidate experience aligned with Rome Business School and PFU standards
* Design and deliver structured induction programmes, buddy scheme \& “PFU\-RBS Onboarding” sessions.
* Coordinate contractual documentation, Work\-Life folder, tax and social\-security registration (INPS/INAIL) in partnering with out Labor consultant.
* Support to the PFU HRBP with annual goal\-setting, Performance appraisal reviews and calibration with managers. **Support with individual development plans
column2: coordinate learning** interventions.

column1: * Anticipate legal risks and propose mitigation. **Maintain personnel files, privacy consents (GDPR) and** mandatory postings.

* Track mandatory medical examinations \& safety training
* Promote well\-being initiatives.
**Mandatory Requirements:**
**Education**: Bachelor’s degree in Law, Business Administration or related field.
**Experience**: Minimum **5 years as HR Generalist or HRBP** in Italy, with proven
ownership of end\-to\-end employee life\-cycle.
**Legislative Expertise**:
1\. Deep knowledge of **Italian labour law**
2\. Familiar with CCNL negotiations and updates.
3\. **Solid knowledge of** ***Categorie Protette*** **(Law 68/1999\)** — able to calculate mandatory hiring quotas, manage targeted recruitment and annual reports
**Language Skills**: Fluent Italian (C2\) and English (C1\), Spanish Highly valued

1\. Meticulous **attention to detail \& organisation** – zero tolerance for compliance gaps.
2\. Strong business acumen with ability to **anticipate legal and employee\- relations risks**.
3\. Influencing \& coaching skills
column2: able to challenge and support leaders.

in-c13d74a7cd582ad2,"indeed","https://it.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=c13d74a7cd582ad2","https://www.lvmh.com/join-us/our-job-offers/FEND04339","WW Compensation & Benefits, HR Operations and Transformation Director","Fendi","Roma, LAZ, IT","2026-02-23","fulltime","","","","","",False,"","","","","### **Position**

The HR Compensation \& Benefits, HR Operations and Transformation Director plays a pivotal role at the intersection of HR economics, financial discipline, tech evolution and organizational transformation across all regions.

The position is responsible for shape and governing competitive and sustainable compensation, benefit, HR budgeting, controlling, reporting and HR tech frameworks, ensuring control and planning of workforce costs, and leading HR transformation initiatives aligned with company’s positioning and business strategy.

The role acts as a strategic partner to the Company CEO, CFO and Business Leaders, as well as Group HR teams, translating people\-related decisions into measurable impact on performance, productivity and profitability, with particular attention to Retail operations and international markets.
It ensures competitive and equitable reward structure, oversees salary reviews, job evaluation, mobility offers, and reporting.
The profile will report to the Chief People Officer.
### **Job responsibilities**
* Lead Compensation, Benefits \& Reward Strategy worldwide, and ensure its effective implementation
* Define, implement and govern global compensation and benefits frameworks, ensuring alignment with Brand values, performance culture and the Group guidelines
* Oversee short and long\-term incentive schemes for corporate and retail populations, balancing pay\-for\-performance principles with luxury culture and sustainability Group strategy
* Lead the job evaluation (job weight) methodology and annual salary review process, ensuring consistency with LVMH policies, internal equity and alignment with market benchmarks across geographies
* Ensure internal equity, external competitiveness and regulatory compliance across all geographies – with a strong focus on EU pay transparency directive
* Oversee key aspects of payroll globally, ensuring accuracy and compliance
* Lead HR cost control initiatives, analysing expenditures, and identifying areas for efficiency improvements
* Drive to the annual HR and payroll budgeting process, providing data\-driven insights and forecasting personnel\-related costs to support strategic financial planning
* Monitor and analyze labor cost evolution, productivity and efficiency indicators across regions and business units, with a key focus on Retail

* Collaborate closely with the Retail Excellence dept. to develop and refine workforce planning models and incentives schemes, linked to business drivers (traffic, sales, store formats, productivity targets, etc.)
* Drive all HR reporting initiatives, including annual report and scorecard, ensuring global data accuracy
* Drive HRIS transformation initiatives aimed at increasing effectiveness, transparency and data\-driven decision\-making
* Lead the technology evolution in HR processes, tools and governance models in line with Group standards and best practices
* Globally sponsor and coordinate tech \& AI HR transformation projects impacting organization, roles, performance management and people analytics
* Act as key interface with Group stakeholders on reward policies, benchmarking and governance topics
* Ensure strong HR governance, and policies worldwide, supporting scalability and consistency.
### **Profile**
**Profile \& Experience**
* Significant experience in leading Compensation \& Benefits, HR Cost Controlling, Workforce Planning within matrixed and international organizations
* Strong exposure to Retail and/or consumer\-facing businesses
column2: experience in luxury or premium environments is a strong asset

column1: * Proven track record in leading technologic transformation projects and operating in matrix, international contexts
* Solid understanding of financial concepts (P\&L, cost structures, business cases) applied to people’s decisions
* Strong experience in interacting with C\-level executives and senior stakeholders.
**Skills \& Competencies**
* Strategic and analytical mindset with strong business acumen
* Ability to connect people, numbers and operations
* Credibility and discretion in high\-level matrix environments
* Influencing skills and ability to operate without direct authority
* International mindset and cultural sensitivity.
**Education \& Languages**
* Master’s degree in economics, Finance, Business Administration or equivalent
* MBA or Executive MBA preferred
* Fluent English required
column2: Italian highly recommended.

column1: ### **Additional information**
*LVMH is committed to non\-discrimination and respect of each person’s singularities.* *We recognize and recruit all types of talent.*
***FENDI***
**MAISON**

The Fendi Maison was established by Adele and Edoardo Fendi in Rome in 1925\. The opening of the first Fendi boutique – a handbag shop and fur workshop followed. Soon winning international acclaim, Fendi emerged as a brand renowned for its elegance, craftsmanship, innovation and style.

Called by the legendary five Fendi sisters, the collaboration with the late Karl Lagerfeld began back in 1965 and lasted 54 years. In 1992, Silvia Venturini Fendi seconded him in the Artistic Direction

Since 2020, Delfina Delettrez Fendi, fourth generation of the Fendi family, is Artistic Director of Jewellery. in-06d2aee0d30d59ce,"indeed","https://it.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=06d2aee0d30d59ce","https://enav.intervieweb.it/jobs/hr-application-specialist-area-it-111482/it/","HR Application Specialist – Area IT","Enav","Roma, LAZ, IT","2026-02-23","","","","","","",False,"","","","","### **Descrizione azienda**

*Ogni giorno accompagniamo chi vola con affidabilità e sicurezza. Disegniamo il cielo del futuro, investendo sulle persone e sull’innovazione per un trasporto aereo sostenibile e per la crescita economica del Paese.*

Siamo il service provider italiano per i servizi alla navigazione aerea civile, tra i Big 5 in Europa per l’eccellenza nelle performance operative. Grazie alle 4\.200 persone del Gruppo gestiamo il traffico aereo dalle nostre 45 Torri e dai 4 Centri di Controllo d’Area, garantendo sicurezza e puntualità 24 ore su 24 a milioni di passeggeri e ci prendiamo cura del cielo, disegnando traiettorie sempre più efficienti e sostenibili. Siamo l’unica società in Italia autorizzata a selezionare, formare e aggiornare i diversi profili professionali che operano nei servizi per il controllo del traffico aereo civile. Stiamo rivoluzionando il controllo del traffico aereo italiano, attraverso iniziative di integrazione dello spazio aereo tradizionale con quello dedicato ai velivoli a pilotaggio remoto.
### **Posizione**

Entrerai a far parte della Struttura *Corporate IT Application* con il ruolo di *HR Application Specialist* e ti occuperai dell’evoluzione dei sistemi HR amministrativi (payroll, time management, travel, etc). Sarai il punto di raccordo tra HR e Information Technology, contribuendo alla corretta implementazione e personalizzazione delle soluzioni applicative HR dedicate all’amministrazione del personale.
Nello specifico, il focus delle attività sarà il seguente:
* Supportare gli utenti di business nell’utilizzo dei sistemi applicativi
* Garantire il coordinamento tra gli utenti di business e i fornitori esterni per la risoluzione di anomalie applicative
* Tradurre le esigenze del business in specifiche funzionali per l’evoluzione dei sistemi applicativi
* Garantire il coordinamento specialistico nei progetti di implementazione, upgrade o migrazione dei sistemi applicativi
* Proporre miglioramenti continui ai processi digitali
### **Requisiti**
* Laurea triennale e/o magistrale in discipline STEM o economiche (es: Informatica, Ingegneria Gestionale, Economia, etc)
* esperienza, almeno triennale, in ruoli di supporto applicativo e di consulenza funzionale in ambito HR, con focus sui processi di Amministrazione del Personale
* esperienza maturata in progetti di integrazione applicativa tra sistemi HR e i principali sistemi aziendali (ERP), con competenze tecniche nella gestione dei flussi dati e delle interfacce
* conoscenza operativa di almeno uno dei principali software HR (es. SAP SuccessFactors, Oracle HCM, Workday, Zucchetti, ADP, ecc.)
* conoscenza della lingua inglese al livello B2 o superiore (*Rif: CEFR*)
* conoscenza della lingua italiana al livello C1 o superiore (*Rif: CEFR*).
Costituirà requisito preferenziale aver maturato un’esperienza funzionale su processi di HR Development (Talent Management, Formazione e sviluppo delle competenze, Performance Management, etc.) .
**Range retributivo di riferimento: 45\-50K€**
### **Altre informazioni**
**I nostri Valori**

ENAV Group promuove la diversità in tutte le sue forme, valorizza l'unicità di ogni persona e si impegna ogni giorno a costruire un ambiente di lavoro sostenibile. Talento, competenza e diversità sono i valori in cui crediamo, consapevoli che il capitale umano è il nostro asset più importante.
Raccontaci le esperienze di valore che hai maturato, siamo pronti ad offrirti formazione per lo sviluppo delle tue competenze.
**Avrai la possibilità di candidarti a questo Job Posting dalle ore 16:00 del 23/02/2026 alle ore 16:00 del 09/03/2026!**
**La selezione non è rivolta ai dipendenti del Gruppo ENAV assunti a tempo indeterminato.**","","https://it.indeed.com/cmp/Enav","","http://www.enav.com.ar","","","","","","","","","","","recruiter"

Job Description:
We are looking for an HR Manager to lead the full HR agenda of our Chemical plant in Aprilia.
The role requires daily HR plant management, good knowledge of industrial relations, and a strong ability to manage eterogeneous stakeholders on a daily basis.
**What You Will Do**
* Be the primary point of reference for daily HR business partnering activities for the Aprilia plant
* Manage and guide daily industrial relations with Unions/RSU
* Manage all contractual, legal, and administrative HR processes together with HR Administration
* Partner with the local Leadership Team to support business priorities and workforce effectiveness by implementing a team leadership model that builds trust and encourages collaboration
* Execute workforce planning, budgeting, and personnel cost forecasting
* Monitor, analyze, and leverage key HR KPIs to support informed decision\-making
Manage recruitment for both white\-collar and blue\-collar employees
* Support talent development initiatives by identifying critical skills, career growth pathways, and retention actions, in line with COE strategy
* Drive performance management processes, coaching managers to set clear objectives and ensure fair evaluations that promote accountability, meritocracy, and business performance
* Oversee training activities to support upskilling, reskilling, and organizational development
* Foster a positive employee experience by enhancing the Employee Value Proposition and promoting a culture of empowerment, trust, and openness.
**What We Are Looking For**
* Degree in Economics, Law, Psychology, Engineering, or related fields
* 3\-5 years of HR experience
* Strong stakeholder management and communication skills
* Good analytical and data management skills, with the ability to understand KPIs and translate data into actions
* Experience in Industrial Relations and Union/RSU management – **is a plus**
* Fluent Italian and good English.","","https://it.indeed.com/cmp/Angelini-Pharma","","","","","","","","","","","","","recruiter"

29 March 2026\-23:59\-GMT\+01:00 Central European Time (Rome)*WFP celebrates and embraces diversity. It is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all its employees and encourages qualified candidates to apply irrespective of race, colour, national origin, ethnic or social background, genetic information, gender, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, religion or belief, HIV status or disability.*
ABOUT WFP

The World Food Programme is the world’s largest humanitarian organization saving lives in emergencies and using food assistance to build a pathway to peace, stability and prosperity, for people recovering from conflict, disasters and the impact of climate change.

At WFP, people are at the heart of everything we do and the vision of the future WFP workforce is one of diverse, committed, skilled, and high performing teams, selected on merit, operating in a healthy and inclusive work environment, living WFP's values (Integrity, Collaboration, Commitment, Humanity, and Inclusion) and working with partners to save and change the lives of those WFP serves.
To learn more about WFP, visit our website: https://www.wfp.org
WHY JOIN WFP?* WFP is a 2020 Nobel Peace Prize Laureate.
* WFP offers a highly inclusive, diverse, and multicultural working environment.

* WFP invests in the personal \& professional development of its employees through a range of training, accreditation, coaching, mentorship, and other programs as well as through internal mobility opportunities.

* A career path in WFP provides an exciting opportunity to work across the various country, regional and global offices around the world, and with passionate colleagues who work tirelessly to ensure that effective humanitarian assistance reaches millions of people across the globe.
* We offer an attractive compensation package (please refer to the Terms and Conditions section of this vacancy announcement).
JOB TITLE: Individual Giving – Republic of Korea Fundraising Coordinator
Private Sector Partnerships (PSP)
DUTY STATION: Remote
CONTRACT TYPE: Regular Consultant (CST\-1\)
DURATION: 11 months
LINE MANAGER/SUPERVISOR: Head of International Fundraising Solutions
ORGANIZATIONAL CONTEXT

The Private Partnerships Division (PSP) is responsible for mobilizing resources from the private sector. PSP has developed an ambitious five\-year strategy and our ambition is based on need. The World Food Programme (WFP) is the leading humanitarian organization saving lives and changing lives, delivering food assistance in emergencies, and working with communities to improve nutrition and build resilience.

Work as hard as we might, through drought and floods, conflict and peace, disasters natural or man\-made, the needs are immense and growing. 828 million people in the world do not have enough food to eat. To get to a world with *Zero Hunger* faster, WFP has significantly increased resources in recent years from donor governments, and now investing in and growing private sector fundraising to reach more people.

WFP’s private sector strategy (2020 – 2025\) has already dramatically increased income from individuals to help reach more people and get to *Zero Hunger* faster, using new digital engagement tools to reach audiences across the globe in a flexible and cost\-effective way.
WFP has a unique opportunity to define its approach amid this digital change, and leapfrog peers through a fundraising strategy that engages people worldwide from one centralized team.
INDIVIDUAL FUNDRAISING

WFP currently has the fastest growing global individual fundraising programme. Our success has been founded on a digital\-first strategy, working through a centralized global team recruiting supporters primarily through digital channels (Meta, TikTok \& Google) and building an outstanding supporter experience through a multi\-channel loyalty programme that aims to deliver a best\-in\-class donor experience. The programme now recruits donors in English, French, German, Spanish and Arabic, with language capabilities also including Korean, and it delivers the supporter experience through email, SMS, WhatsApp, outbound telephone and social media in over 192 countries.

Individual Giving Fundraising in The Republic of Korea began in 2019 with a low volume test of DRTV, but it was not until 2025 that a full multichannel program was launched with DRTV, and Paid Digital campaigns, led by a local Partnerships Officer within the IG team. Following a successful year with an established regular giving supporter base of over 10,000 donors, the Republic of Korea has been identified as a priority growth market with its own requirements for localised solutions and resource.
PURPOSE OF THE ASSIGNMENT

WFP’s Individual Giving team is seeking a dynamic, results\-driven, and resourceful Republic of Korea Fundraising Coordinator to support the development and expansion of WFP’s fundraising program for this market. The successful candidate will build on the activities to date to help establish the foundations for a sustainable IG program and continue the growth trajectory.

The role will involve optimizing operations, identifying new opportunities for growth, and developing a best\-in\-class supporter experience. A strong focus will be placed on innovation, ensuring that WFP develops as a market leader in IG fundraising by integrating emerging technologies, best practices, and data\-driven decision\-making.
The candidate will play a key role in building strong and successful partnerships with agencies to deliver outstanding results while maintaining WFP’s reputation for excellence.
ACCOUNTABILITIES / RESPONSIBILITIES
The Republic of Korea Fundraising Coordinator will be responsible for the following:

Supporter Experience* Develop and support all relevant platforms, payment gateways, CRM and donation receipting processes, ensuring local data privacy regulations are considered and all relevant data captured.
* Adapt and manage donor journeys to ensure relevance for Republic of Korea donors across language, content and channels.
* Improve the handling of supporter queries, especially at peak times such as end of year donation receipts.
Planning* Ongoing review of available market data to help inform and develop the overall fundraising strategy
* Support with the annual review, planning and budgeting processes for IG in Republic of Korea
Project Management* Oversee local procurement processes to secure additional fundraising services as required
* Ensure effective management of annual donation receipting processes so that donors' gifts are tax deductible, receipts available and regulatory requirements covered
* Promote the interests of IG with locally owned assets and media channels
* Ensure all paid media activities and donor facing communications are aligned
* Develop and deliver training packages for all relevant suppliers within the Republic of Korea
Results and analysis* Alongside PSP Colleagues, review daily, weekly and monthly IG fundraising performance reports and work with agencies to optimize performance.
* Track and analyze the performance of Republic of Korea donors and make recommendations to improve the KPIs that drive long term profitability.
QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
Education* University degree in marketing or other relevant disciplines.
Work history* At least 5 years of professional experience in Marketing, Individual Giving, and/or paid media in international organizations or companies.
* Proven track record of managing programs, including agency partnerships, budgets, and supporter acquisition/retention
* Familiarity with integrating campaigns into broader individual giving and digital fundraising strategies.
Technical expertise* Working knowledge of the marketing/fundraising campaign processes including supporting TECH stack solutions – CRM, payment gateways \& landing pages
* Skills and knowledge of retention and donor development activities for individual giving
* Copywriting for international development/humanitarian causes and excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.
Soft skills* Self\-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines, and reporting, with the ability to manage multiple, concurrent priorities on tight deadlines
* Excellent communicator with ability to work collaboratively with colleagues across different cultures, disciplines, and time zones.
* Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills
* Well organized and detail oriented.
* Able to articulate complex concepts in non\-technical language.
* Values diversity in the workplace, particularly valuing respectfulness and inclusively leveraging everyone's talents.
* Availability for ‘out of hours’ on\-call work including at weekends in the case of a humanitarian or other emergency appeal.
* People\-oriented. Uses tact and courtesy to give and receive information with a variety of individuals.
* Motivated team spirit and contributed to a gender\-balanced, inclusive, and sound working environment.
Language(s)* Republic of Korea native speaker
* Excellent command of spoken and written English
WFP LEADERSHIP FRAMEWORK
WFP Leadership Framework guides to the common standards of behavior that guide HOW we work together to accomplish our mission.
REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION

NO FEE DISCLAIMER

Il/la **Tecnico Services Senior \- Distribuzione Elettrica** (BT/MT) è un/una tecnico\-trasfertista esperto/a.

La persona presterà assistenza tecnica e manutentiva presso i siti dei nostri clienti distribuiti su tutto il territorio italiano e occasionalmente all'estero, diventando un vero e proprio punto di riferimento.

Si occuperà di attività di installazione, manutezione, analisi, risoluzioni guasti, ammodernamenti di apparecchiature di distribuzione elettrica (quadri, interruttori e relè di protezione MT e BT). **Di che cosa ti occuperai?*** Fornire assistenza tecnica e/o interventi di diagnostica su apparecchiature guaste
* Manutenzione ordinaria, preventiva e predittiva su prodotti specifici
* Attività di revamping, ampliamento e/o adeguamento di impianti esistenti
* Attività di installazione e commissioning di Quadri MT/BT e dei relativi relè di protezione
* Configurazione dei prodotti in accordo alle specifiche tecniche
* Consulenza ai clienti e identificazione di possibile migliorie ad Asset e/o impianti
* Esegue la mappatura della base installata e raccoglie le informazioni necessarie per assistere al meglio i clienti e diventa promotore del marchio Schneider Electric
* Si occupa di emettere i report di quanto eseguito sul campo, promuovendo la manutenzione preventiva e le future opportunità sulla base delle informazioni raccolte
Qualifications:
**Chi stiamo cercando?*** Ottima conoscenza e capacità di lettura ed interpretazione degli schemi elettrici
* Buona conoscenza e capacità di lettura base di uno studio di selettività fornito dallo studio di ingegneria
* Strutturata esperienza in lavori di installazione/manutezione/aggiornamenti/risoluzione guasti su quadri elettrici e interruttori MT/BT
* Ottima conoscenza dei relè di protezione MT/BT e loro relativa programmazione
* Discreta conoscenza dell'inglese tecnico (sia scritto che parlato)
* Mentalità focalizzata sul cliente con una forte capacità di ascolto
* Forte senso di responsabilità e spirito di iniziativa
* Capacità di adattarsi in un ambiente fortemente dinamico
* Le capacità relazioni sia verso i clienti sia verso colleghi e partner sono alla base del profilo ricercato, come anche le capacità di problem solving
**Cosa Offre Schneider Electric?*** Contratto a tempo indeterminato
* Percorso formativo iniziale
* Possibilità di partecipare a progetti nazionali e internazionali
* Flessibilità sul lavoro
* Opportunità di lavorare in un'azienda internazionale con progetti cross\-regionali
* Opportunità di crescita con percorsi di sviluppo chiari
* Ambiente di lavoro inclusivo con pari opportunità
* Programma Global Family Leave
* Ticket restaurant o pasto in mensa
* Piani di azionariato
* Programmi di Welfare estendibili alla famiglia
* Assicurazione sanitaria e infortuni professionale/extraprofessionale

in-5ef538420a4e3017,"indeed","https://it.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=5ef538420a4e3017","https://careers.axpo.com/jobs/7277287-grid-connection-manager-f-m-d","Grid Connection Manager (f/m/d)","Axpo group","Roma, LAZ, IT","2026-02-23","","","","","","",False,"","","","","**Workload: 100%**

Join Axpo Solar/Urbasolar in Italy to accelerate the energy transition. You’ll shape grid connections for utility\-scale PV plants, work across Europe, and collaborate with diverse experts who value innovation, teamwork, and impact.
**What you will do:**
* **Development \& Strategic Support:** Validate technical parameters for new projects, develop interconnection strategies, and evaluate project risks.
* **General Coordination \& Compliance:** Manage DSO/TSO relationships, ensure compliance with grid codes, and oversee technical portals.
* **HV/MV Grid Connection Line Management:** Coordinate grid connection works, manage engineering/construction contracts, and secure permits with DSOs/TSOs,
* **HV Substation Management:** Define technical specifications for HV substations, manage engineering/construction contracts, and lead commissioning processes.
* **MV Stations Design:** Review and approve technical offers for MV transformers and delivery stations, ensuring compliance with project requirements and grid regulations.
* **PV Plant Electrical Systems:** Support MV electrical integration, lead commissioning, and obtain permits for PV plants.
* **Process Improvement \& Coordination:** Enhance reporting tools, drive design improvements, and coordinate grid connection procedures across project zones.
**What you bring \& who you are:**
**Must\-have qualifications:**
* Technical degree in Electrical Engineering.
* 8\+ years of experience in renewable energy grid connection or working with Italian grid operators.
* Signature authority is required for MV/LV electrical engineering documents in Italy.
* Expertise in MV/HV electrical design, Italian Grid Code, and DSO/TSO procedures.
* MS Office, AutoCAD, and electrical simulation software (e.g., DigSilent, Etap).
**Nice\-to\-have skills:**
* Strong project management and organizational skills.
* Leadership and adaptability in dynamic environments.
* Analytical mindset with excellent communication abilities.
* Creativity and customer\-oriented approach.
Even if you don’t meet all the criteria, we encourage you to apply and showcase your unique strengths!
**About the team:**

You will join a dynamic and collaborative team dedicated to advancing renewable energy projects in Italy. We value diversity, innovation, and teamwork, ensuring every voice is heard and every perspective contributes to our success.

*At Axpo Group, we are dedicated to fostering a culture of non\-discrimination, tolerance, and inclusion. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications regardless of race and ethnicity, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, as well as socioeconomic, cultural, and religious background. We are committed to ensuring a respectful and inclusive recruiting process and workplace for everyone.*","","https://it.indeed.com/cmp/Axpo-Group","","","","","","","","","","","","","recruiting"

Kenvue is currently recruiting for:
**R\&D Deployment Manager Consumer Science**
This position reports into the VP R\&D EMEA and is based in Pomezia, Italy.
**What we do**

At Kenvue, we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands \- including NEUTROGENA®, AVEENO®, LISTERINE®, JOHNSON’S® and BAND\-AID® that you already know and love. Science is our passion

column1: **Who we are**

Our global team is \~ 22,000 brilliant people with a workplace culture where every voice matters, and every contribution is appreciated. We are passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours. For more information, click here.
**What will you do**

The **R\&D Deployment Manager, Consumer Science** leads the execution of consumer‑centric research to translate scientific and consumer insights into actionable actions that support brand growth. This role combines consumer science technical expertise and strategic thinking, that enable the leadership to drive evidence‑based decision‑making across multiple categories and markets.
Key Responsibilities
**Consumer Learning \& Testing Execution:**
* Execute consumer learning plans and testing strategies to deliver timely, high quality insights aligned to business and projects objectives.
* Execute consumer research that uncovers consumer behavioral, cultural, and sensory insights to support projects and marketing strategies.
* Integrate deep consumer research expertise with strong business acumen, ensuring good understanding of business partner needs and delivering impactful, business‑relevant scientific insights.
**Insight Translation\& Deployment:**
* Translate consumer research findings into clear, actionable insights that identify opportunities and execute strategic decisions.

* As subject matter expert, partner with R\&D, marketing, and Consumer Business Intelligence (CBI) teams to deploy robust claim substantiation, translate complex scientific and consumer data into compelling, consumer centric evidence to support projects, claims and communication.
**Human\-Centered Methodologies:**
* Apply human\-centered research approaches, providing expertise and guidance to support the deployment of new products and consumer experiences.
* Pioneer and apply advanced research methodologies, including sensory evaluation, consumer testing, and digital tools to strengthen consumer research and digital capabilities
**Cross\-Functional Collaboration:**
* Build strong, trusted partnerships across regional and global stakeholders to ensure alignment between consumer insights, technical feasibility and business objectives.
* Influence cross functional decision\-making through scientific expertise, data‑driven support, and evidence‑based perspectives, to enable and deliver meaningful outcomes for consumers
**Team Leadership:**
* Build strategic connections across need states to align business priorities, and support long‑term pipeline and portfolio strategy.
* Build and grow deep consumer research expertise by coaching and mentoring team members to elevate expertise and capabilities.
* Fostering a culture of curiosity, inclusivity, continuous learning and high performance within the team.
* Responsible for effective budget management, ensure robust budget tracking and all spending are met within approved budget plan.
**Quality compliance:**
* Provide oversight and accountability to ensure all research activities comply with industry and company standards.

* Drive consistent application of approved research procedures, SOPs, and quality practices across projects and teams. Identify and proactively mitigate compliance risks, support audit and inspection readiness.
**External Engagement:**
* Cultivate relationships with industry partners, external agencies and academic institutions to enhance research capabilities and thought leadership.
**Industry Awareness:**
* Stay at forefront of the latest advancements, methodologies and trends in consumer research and relevant industries to continuously enhance organizational expertise and knowledge sharing.
**What we are looking for**
Required Qualifications

* A minimum of a Bachelor's or Master's degree with approximately 8\-10 years of industry experience is required, Biology/Chemistry/Chemical Engineering/Pharmacology degrees preferred but not mandatory.
* Relevant experience in consumer science, with a proven track record of success.

* Being able to connect cross\-functionally to determine testing needs for various projects. These projects can fall under any of our categories (Baby Care, Women’s Health, Oral Care, Skin Health and Beauty, Self Care / OTC medicines).
* Previous experience of managing a team of consumer/market researchers in FMCG, Health care, or research agencies.
* Up to 10% international travel may be needed.
Desired Qualifications
* Previous experience on consumer/market researchers, and/or claim support and substantiation. FMCG, Health care, or research agencies would be preferred, but open to relevant fields.
* Previous experience on various types of consumer and market research methodologies (i.e. qualitative, quantitative).
* Previous experience on sensory evaluation methods and data interpretation.
**What’s in it for you:**
* Competitive Total Rewards Package
* Learning \& Development Opportunities
* Kenvuer Impact Networks

*Kenvue is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment based on merit without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against based on disability.*

If you are an individual with a disability, please check our Disability Assistance page for information on how to request an accommodation.","","https://it.indeed.com/cmp/Kenvue-1","https://d2q79iu7y748jz.cloudfront.net/s/_squarelogo/256x256/90047e09e7ef26d5388996189333ef37","http://kenvue.com/careers","1 Kenvue Way, Summit, NJ 07901","10,000+","","A new view of care 🤍#WeAreKenvue​","","","","","","","recruiting"

in-f6ea84d71caaf5fd,"indeed","https://it.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=f6ea84d71caaf5fd","https://fa-etjb-saasfaprod1.fa.ocs.oraclecloud.com/hcmUI/CandidateExperience/en/sites/CX_1/requisitions/preview/2179","Project Manager ambito OnLine Banking","BIP","Roma, LAZ, IT","2026-02-23","fulltime","","","","","",False,"","","","","***Entra nel nostro mondo.***
***Trasforma insieme a noi.***

**Quale sarà la tua sfida?**Sarai parte attiva della crescita della nostra practice Financial Services, siamo in grado di anticipare le continue evoluzioni del mondo Fintech, mettendo a disposizione le nostre competenze alle principali banche, assicurazioni e Payment Service Providers presenti sul mercato. Supportiamo i servizi finanziari nel rinnovamento e sviluppo tecnologico, in ambito Open Innovation, Data Economy e Omnicanalità, agendo sulle leve del P\&L value initiatives e dell’Enterprise Value/Share Value .
**Project Manager ambito Home \& OnLine Banking**
**Sei tu il nostro nuovo collega?**Fai application se hai maturato un’esperienza compresa tra i 3 e i 9 anni presso primarie società di consulenza e sei in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:
* Hai una buona conoscenza del mondo bancario
* Hai maturato esperienze pregresse su progetti di evoluzione ed implementazione di nuove funzionalità su processi di Home Banking (web e app)

* Hai una buona conoscenza delle principali funzionalità e processi Online Banking (es. apertura c/c on line, Digital Lending, Onboarding digitale e adeguata verifica sui canali digitali, preventivatori creditizi online, processi di vendita a distranza OAD, aggiornamento anagrafico, etc.)
* Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
* Familiarità con metodologie di Project Management
* Coordinamento delle attività progettuali con team interni ed esterni
* Interazione con stakeholder di alto livello per garantire coerenza tra requisiti normativi e obiettivi strategici dei clienti.
**Perchè Bip?**
***People at the center of our culture***
Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialità e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.
Lavorare in BIP è un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti.
***Challenge yourself***

Avrai la possibilità di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attività e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l’autonomia e la capacità di assumerti responsabilità e metterti in gioco.
***Unlocking your potential***
Potrai partecipare a \+ di 300 corsi formativi all’avanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.
***Work\-life Integration***
Troverai una policy che supporta il lavoro AGILE fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work\-life integration.
**Next Steps**

Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente. Se c’è un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all’interno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca. L’iter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner. L’ordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting. In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunità future. Se dovessi identificare tu stesso ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.
**Su di Noi**
Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l’esperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l’innovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 3500 professionisti, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 5000 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze più all’avanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4\.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.
Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualità su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell’eccellenza, che è la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.
